Pollock. (Photo: David Kadlubowski/azcentral sports) 
Arizona Diamondbacks center fielder A.J. Pollock posted Wednesday that he hiked the notoriously difficult Camelback Mountain in just over 27 minutes, putting the rest of us to shame.
He scaled the 1.3 mile, double-black-diamond Echo Canyon Summit Trail in 27 minutes and 20.04 seconds, according to his Instagram post.
The hike should take 45 minutes one way for fit hikers, according to the city of Phoenix website , which rates the trail's difficulty as "extremely strenuous and difficult."
MLB MOCK DRAFT: Diamondbacks go with a pitcher? 
Pollock's wife, Kate, hiked with him and matched his impressive time, according to his post.
"Um- Glad I did NOT join you two this morning!!," one woman commented.
"I'm sure Kate would've been nice if u were there...she always tries to kill me," Pollock replied.
Congratulations on your utter athleticism, A.J. No one is jealous at all.
MORE: Diamondbacks trade history - notable deals 
Parking lot to top of camelback with @kate_pollock1 Echo canyon side. What are the best times out there? #camelbackchallange #camelbackmountain #arizonahiking
